availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Algernon S. Walker (Allen County, Kentucky, physician.)

body.p: Allen County, Kentucky, physician. Jessmine County, Kentucky, native. Married to Melvina M. McReynolds Walker in Allen County, Kentucky, on September 11, 1832. Father of [Unknown] Walker, Elbridge G. Walker, S. H. Walker, David C. Walker, [Unknown] Walker, Robert Walker, John H. Walker, Jacob B. C. Walker, A.S. Walker, Melvina J. Walker, Mary G. Walker, and Queen Walker. Resident of Allen County in 1840. Owned two enslaved persons in Allen County in 1840. Physician in Allen County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Allen County in 1850. Physician in Allen County in 1860. Employed Mariah Walker as a housekeeper in 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons including James, Rose, and Lilley in 1860.
